content:
ListViewItem Class

In this Article

Represents an individual item in a ListView control.

Syntax

Declaration

[System.ComponentModel.ToolboxItem(false)]
public class ListViewItem : System.Web.UI.Control, System.Web.UI.IDataItemContainer

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • System.Web.UI.Control
  • ListViewItem

Remarks

The ListViewItem class is used to represent an individual item in a ListView control. An individual item usually represents a record in the underlying data source of a ListView control.

Each item in the ListView control has a designated item type, as listed in the following table.

Item type Description
ListViewItemType A data item in the ListView control.
ListViewItemType An insert item in the ListView control.
ListViewItemType An empty item in the ListView control. The empty item is displayed when the ListView control does not have any records to display, or when a group in the ListView control does not have any more records to display.

To determine the type of a ListViewItem object, use the ItemType property.

If an item contains other controls, you can retrieve a control by using the Controls collection of the item. If the control's ID property is set, you can also use the FindControl method to find the control.

For a list of initial property values for an instance of ListViewItem, see the ListViewItem constructor.

Constructors summary

ListViewItem(ListViewItemType)

Initializes a new instance of the ListViewItem class.

Properties summary

DataItem

Gets or sets the underlying data object that the ListViewItem object is bound to.
DataItemIndex

Gets the index of the data item that is bound to the ListViewItem control.
DisplayIndex

Gets the position of the data item as displayed in the ListView control.
ItemType

Gets the item type of the ListViewItem object.

Methods summary

OnBubbleEvent(Object,EventArgs)

Determines whether to pass an event up the page's ASP.NET server control hierarchy.

Constructors

  • ListViewItem(ListViewItemType)

    Initializes a new instance of the ListViewItem class.

    public ListViewItem (System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewItemType itemType);

    Parameters

    • itemType
      ListViewItemType

      One of the ListViewItemType enumeration values.

    Remarks

    Use this constructor to initialize a new instance of a ListViewItem object.

    The following table shows initial property values for an instance of the ListViewItem class.

    Property Initial value
    ItemType The value of the itemType parameter.

Properties

  • DataItem

    Gets or sets the underlying data object that the ListViewItem object is bound to.

    public virtual object DataItem { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Object

      The underlying data object that the ListViewItem object is bound to.

  • DataItemIndex

    Gets the index of the data item that is bound to the ListViewItem control.

    public virtual int DataItemIndex { get; }

    Property Value

    • Int32

      The index of the data item that is bound to the ListViewItem control.

  • DisplayIndex

    Gets the position of the data item as displayed in the ListView control.

    public virtual int DisplayIndex { get; }

    Property Value

    • Int32

      The position of the data item as displayed in the ListView control.

  • ItemType

    Gets the item type of the ListViewItem object.

    public System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewItemType ItemType { get; }

    Property Value

    • ListViewItemType

      One of the ListViewItemType values.

    Remarks

    Use the ItemType property to determine the type of item that the ListViewItem object represents, as listed in the following table.

    Item type Description
    ListViewItemType A data item in the ListView control.
    ListViewItemType An insert item in the ListView control.
    ListViewItemType An empty item in the ListView control. The empty item is displayed when the ListView control does not have any records to display, or when a group in the ListView control does not have any more records to display.

    You typically use this property to determine an item's type before you perform an operation.

    Example

    The following example shows how to use the ItemType property to determine whether the item that is being created is a data item. If the item is a data item, the e-mail address is displayed in italic. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the ListViewItem class. 

      protected void ContactsListView_ItemCreated(object sender, ListViewItemEventArgs e)
  {
    // Retrieve the current item.
    ListViewItem item = e.Item;

    // Verify if the item is a data item.
    if (item.ItemType == ListViewItemType.DataItem)
    {
      // Get the EmailAddressLabel Label control in the item.
      Label EmailAddressLabel = (Label)item.FindControl("EmailAddressLabel");
      
      // Display the e-mail address in italics.
      EmailAddressLabel.Font.Italic = true;
    }
  }

      Protected Sub ContactsListView_ItemCreated(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal e As ListViewItemEventArgs)
    
    ' Retrieve the current item.
    Dim item As ListViewItem = e.Item
    
    ' Verify if the item is a data item.
    If item.ItemType = ListViewItemType.DataItem Then
            
      ' Get the EmailAddressLabel Label control in the item.      
      Dim EmailAddressLabel As Label = CType(item.FindControl("EmailAddressLabel"), Label)
      
      ' Display the e-mail address in italics.
      EmailAddressLabel.Font.Italic = True
            
    End If

  End Sub

Methods

  • OnBubbleEvent(Object,EventArgs)

    Determines whether to pass an event up the page's ASP.NET server control hierarchy.

    protected override bool OnBubbleEvent (object source, EventArgs e);

    Parameters

    • source
      Object

      The source of the event.

    • e
      EventArgs

      The event data.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the event has been canceled; otherwise, false.
